title: This is not the password I saved
content:
I had used Firefox's (Ff) suggested password for a popular site, saved the suggested password via Ff, and safely and frequently revisited the site.

Yet when I returned to the site today, the Ff saved password was 100's of characters long! This is not my password - what happened?

I contacted the site directly and they suggested talking with Ff as they believe the issue is on my end.

Since that time I changed the password, did not saved it via Ff, and when I return to the site still find the 100's of character password retained.

Ideas?

title: Firefox Window disappears.
content:
I have a Win 10 laptop that i hooked to a Vizio older flat screen tv that I use as monitor 2 and some generic OLD flat screen monitor as monitor 3. I usually run FF on mon. 2. I noticed my laptop was running slow. Firefox was eating resources. I figured i would close some tabs and then my window and restart it. I use the "open previous windows and tabs" ticked. So I can pick up where I left off.

Once closed I it I looked at Task Manager and one instance of it still running. I stop it via Task Manager, rerun FF and see that 2 instances of it re running. I untick "open previous windows and tabs" and shut down FF. When I re start FF it looks fine I open Task Manager and my FF window does a quick slide to the right and disappeared. in task manager I find a search button when you right click FF in the drop down menu. FF quick slides left and Task Manager closes.

Why is this happening to me?

title: Cannot disable dark mode
content: I know this has been asked before but all I see are different answers every time and none of them seem to actually work. After the latest update (4 March 22) suddenly pages that have always been black text on white background are now showing in what looks like dark mode. I have vision impairment and now I can't even see these pages properly without considerable difficulty. I can't go on using Firefox like this and no provision seems to have been made for people who don't actually WANT everything changed on them. Can't I just go back to the way it was? I tried disabling dark themes, tried all these fixes, nothing seems to work. Tried Colours under Languages and Appearance, I can get it at least black-on-white but now all the menu and options colour settings have been lost. All I want is for Firefox to display the themes/modes I set and not second-guess me and set something I didn't. It's utterly ludicrous that you actually set it to disable dark modes but FF forces them on you anyway. Not everyone has the eyes of a young fit person in perfect health. I just want it like it was before... or like I actually SET IT... how come that's so hard? What's going on here? Do I have to abandon Firefox just to not be stuck with an unwanted "feature" that is making it uncomfortable and difficult to even see the d... thing? Why should it take all this "try this, try that, did it work? No again, huh? Well *try* this..." with obscure custom settings that the average user can't understand, just to get a basic display like we've had for decades? At the very least how can I re-install an older version that isn't stuck with this design fail? It's frustrating that I can't finish what I needed to do online because I can't actually SEE the pages I need now and my only option is to go to a completely different browser! Come on, I just want it like it was one day ago... too hard?
creator: berniescables

title: SOCKS v5 authentication
content: ZoogVPN support wrote: «modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox) don't support authentication with SOCKS5, they only support it with HTTP proxies». Is this really true? Mozilla Firefox does not prompt or save username and password when trying to connect to a private SOCKS v5, and the setting "Connection Settings" / "Configure Proxy Access to the Internet" / "Do not prompt for authentication if password is saved" cannot be used to use logins and passwords from SOCKS v5?
creator: Joseff_Key

title: Firefox opening in small screen top left of monitor - solved.
content: Firefox started to open in a small screen at the top left of the monitor, requiring two clicks to make normal size. Some Google suggestions seemed very complex but I found a simple solution from one result. Left click the enlarge tab, then click and drag the screen to full size. Solved. Best to look for a simple solution first before refreshing Firefox or trying registry fixes.

title: Loading and Exiting Problems -- could the "vcruntime140_1.dll" note that appeared when installing?
content:
New Windows 11 HP Laptop here. When installing Firefox, the lack of a "vcruntime140_1.dll" was noted.

I ran Firefox anyway. All seemed well for a bit. However, when exiting out of Firefox, it didn't exit either by hitting the "X" or using the menu and selecting "Exit". I recognized this, because Task Manager showed it still, as a running process. Could the vcruntime140_1.dll issue be a problem? If yes, what is the fix?

I did try "Refreshing" Firefox, to NO avail.

NOTE: Windows 11 Home updates were installed before installing any programs, including Firefox. I had a Windows 11 HP Laptop a couple months ago and Firefox ran just fine on it. But the Laptop developed a screen issue and was replaced by the Laptop in question.

title: v97update tossed out session windows with tabs and i've tried everything to restore the session - can't
content:
the v97 update tossed out 7 of 10 windows with multiple tabs and i hadn't actually saved the bookmarks for all those tabs into folders based on the pages for quite some time because... 

  every time this has happened in the past i've reverted to the old session by deleting the recovery.jsonlz4 and recovery.baklz4 in the profiles\#######\sessionstore-backups folder and copying my conveniently or not so conveniently save backups of the two files into the folder and restarting and shaazaam everything is there - the way it should be but maybe a few days or at worst back to last friday's full sys backup...   however, this time it's not working at all like it used to - it's more like the fox killed my hen in the hallway with the sledge-hammer and took out the floor at the same time....

so, i was successful saving bookmark folders of the pages after going into about:profiles creating a new profile and shoving the sessionstore-backups folder with the appropriate recover. . files into it and launching in a new browser window... the more odder (yes) thing now is that in this profile when i click open previous windows and tabs in settings to have the recovery files built they're now double the size they were - keep in mind the startup of the newly upgraded browser only had 3 of 7 windows kept from the pre-v97 upgrade at 11am (because of a restart) and far far far fewer tabs in total....

anyway, i'ld like to downgrade to 96 and see if i can get my stuff all back together easily but after reading a downgrade page and then looking at the download folders i can't find an install.exe file for versions of 96 because i probably don't know in which of the myriad of folder to look... so i should at least get a briefer on that for future or current use...

short of downgrading is there some way to force my 97 profile to eat my 96 or 95 recovery files and spit out my intact session that got pretty much wiped out ? 

 at this point i have to re-create my profile in this new one, in which, i can get the old session from last friday to load... by re-doing the add-ins... colors... coin wallets... all kinds of crap... it's amazing how dependent i've become on something like this - you folks really should charge for it....
creator: fourcolordoctor
